title: Job Vacancies at Stella Maris School
content:
Stella Maris School is full of happy and highly motivated children. We are committed to providing a warm, welcoming and nurturing atmosphere with a strong educational ethos and moral values.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Junior Project Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Project Planning: Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables. Develop a detailed project plan, including timelines, resources, and budget allocation.
	Team Management: Build and lead project teams, assigning tasks and responsibilities to team members. Provide guidance, support, and motivation to ensure the successful execution of projects.
	Communication and Coordination: Establish effective communication channels with project stakeholders, including school administration, faculty, staff, and external vendors. Facilitate regular project status meetings, provide updates, and address any issues or concerns
	Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies. Proactively monitor project risks and take appropriate actions to minimize their impact on project outcomes.
	Budget and Resource Management: Monitor project budgets and track expenditures. Ensure optimal utilization of resources and identify cost-saving opportunities where possible.
	Quality Assurance: Establish quality standards for project deliverables and monitor adherence to those standards. Conduct regular quality assurance checks and implement necessary corrective actions.
	Documentation and Reporting: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, status reports, and change requests. Provide regular progress reports to project stakeholders and senior management.
	Stakeholder Engagement: Foster positive relationships with project stakeholders and manage their expectations. Seek feedback, address concerns, and ensure their involvement throughout the project lifecycle.
	Change Management: Assess the impact of changes to project scope, timelines, or resources. Implement change management processes to minimize disruption and ensure successful project outcomes.
	Continuous Improvement: Identify lessons learned from completed projects and implement process improvements for future projects. Stay updated on industry best practices and incorporate them into project management approaches.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor’s / Master`s Degree in any relevant field. 


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.assistantsms@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Communications and Marketing Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Are you a creative storyteller with a passion for education, branding, and digital engagement?
	Stella Maris Schools is seeking a Communications & Marketing Manager to lead our communications strategy, digital presence, and brand storytelling across all platforms.


About the Role


	The Communications & Marketing Manager will oversee all internal and external communications, ensuring consistent messaging, brand growth, and strong engagement with parents, students, alumni, and the public.
	You’ll work closely with the Executive Director, Heads of Schools, and the Admissions Teamto design and implement campaigns that reflect the excellence, values, and culture of Stella Maris Schools.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a unified communications and marketing strategy across all school campuses.
	Manage and grow the school’s online presence across social media, website, and newsletters.
	Collaborate with design and admissions teams to create compelling campaigns that drive enrolment.
	Lead brand consistency initiativesfrom visuals to toneacross all communication channels.
	Write, edit, and approve content for newsletters, press releases, and digital media.
	Oversee photography, video, and storytelling initiatives that showcase student life and achievements.
	Track engagement metrics and report performance to leadership.
	Support event marketing, community engagement, and alumni relations.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Marketing, Public Relations, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in communications, digital marketing, or brand management.
	Excellent writing and visual storytelling skills.
	Strong knowledge of social media management tools and analytics.
	Proven ability to plan campaigns and meet deadlines.
	Experience working in an educational or fast-paced organization is an added advantage.


Why Join Us?


	At Stella Maris Schools, you’ll be part of a mission-driven team shaping the next generation of leaders.
	We offer a dynamic, creative environment that values innovation, excellence, and collaboration.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.assistantsms@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Part Time Teacher (Coding and AI)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Part-time

Description


	Subject teachers play a crucial role in the educational process by specializing in a specific academic subject and guiding students through a comprehensive understanding of that discipline.
	They are responsible for planning, executing, and assessing lessons, fostering a positive learning environment, and contributing to the overall academic development of students.


Responsibilities
Curriculum Planning and Development:


	Develop detailed and well-structured lesson plans aligned with the curriculum and educational standards.
	Create engaging and innovative teaching materials, incorporating various instructional strategies to meet diverse learning styles.


Classroom Instruction:


	Deliver lessons that inspire curiosity and critical thinking, making the subject matter accessible and relevant to students.
	Utilize effective teaching methodologies, technology, and resources to enhance the learning experience.


Assessment and Evaluation:


	Prepare and submit question banks on the scheduled date.
	Design and administer assessments to measure students' understanding of the subject.
	Provide constructive feedback to students on their academic performance, identifying areas of improvement and recognizing achievements.


Student Engagement and Support:


	Foster a positive and inclusive learning environment that encourages active participation and collaboration.
	Provide additional support to students who require assistance, addressing individual learning needs.


Collaboration and Professional Development:


	Collaborate with colleagues to integrate cross-disciplinary approaches and contribute to the overall school curriculum.
	Engage in ongoing professional development activities to stay informed about educational trends, advancements, and best practices within the subject area.


Communication:


	
	Maintain open and effective communication with the principal, vice principal- academics, students, and colleagues regarding students' progress, behavior, and academic achievements..
	


Classroom Management:


	Establish and enforce a positive and structured classroom environment conducive to learning.
	Implement effective classroom management strategies to address behavioral issues and maintain a respectful atmosphere.


Continuous Improvement:


	Reflect on teaching practices, seek feedback, and actively participate in self-evaluation to enhance professional growth.
	Contribute to school-wide initiatives and collaborate with peers to continuously improve the overall educational experience for students.
	Any other additional responsibility as may be assigned by the primary head and management.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.assistantsms@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at Bourbon Interoil Nigeria Limited
content:
Bourbon Interoil Nigeria Limited, as leading international player in marine services, offers to the most demanding oil & gas clients worldwide a full line of innovative, safe, high performance and new generation vessels and an expanded offer of offshore oil & gas services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Methods & Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment (QHSE) Manager

Job Location: Rivers

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Lead the strategic development and implementation of operational standards and QHSE expectations across the entire organization (Marine and Logistics, Mobility, Base, Office and Accommodation, etc.) in line with statutory, regulatory, clients, and other stakeholders’ expectations.
	Ensures the deployment, implementation, and improvement of the Bourbon Safety Management and Quality Management System tailored to fit in line with the Management principles stated in the BINL policies.


Responsibilities


	Manage the BINL Quality and HSE processes. 
	Deploy the Operational Standards across the entire Organization.
	Manage Quality and HSE Culture of BINL and its employees, check implementation.
	Develop and Manage HSE and Quality Campaigns and Solutions for Operational Safety.
	Optimize cost and time for remote participation in Safety Meetings. Budget Compliance.
	Sustain Client confidence through active participation in Client's QHSE Meetings.
	Ensure Formalized Quality and HSE competency development for the QHSE team.
	Enhance Administrative, Supervisory and managerial competencies of the QHSE team.
	Act As Designated Person Assure for All BINL Surfer. As required by the ISM and ISPS codes.
	Control all documents from Assist Authors / Process Owners in line to BOURBON Document Standard and structure.
	Track and keep record of Situation Report as well as Management Vessel Visit.
	Monitoring client satisfaction, the QHSE Manager shall follow and measure processes and services given by BINL against policies, objectives, and requirements for the product and report the results taking actions to continually improve the process.
	The QHSE manager shall ensure that customer requirements are defined and met to enhance customer satisfaction. 
	Enhance Mutual Understanding with Clients and Operational Safety Management issues.


Qualifications, Skills and Experiences
Qualifications:


	Minimum of postgraduate qualification in Sciences, Engineering, HSE or Management (MSC, MBA etc.)


Experience:


	Minimum of ten (10) years of postgraduate experience in sciences, engineering, or Management out of which Seven (7) is at HSE Management level within the marine industry.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Mechanic

Job Location: Rivers

Mission


	Assist engineers with preventative and corrective maintenance on all vessels in order to improve vessels' technical availability and reliability.


Responsibilities


	Improve the vessel's technical availability and reliability, thereby reducing costs and downtime.
	Maintain tools under his inventory in good working condition of work.
	Follow QHSE procedures and improve safety during all base maintenance activities.
	Capable of carrying out the jobs related to a PMP and UPMP.
	Knowledge of the structural design and mechanical systems, and equipment related to all BINL vessels.
	Knowledge of the maintenance tools, methodologies and maintenance techniques used on BINL vessels.
	Know how to promote HSE culture awareness in his scope of responsibility.


Qualifications, Skills and Experiences
Qualifications:


	Basic mechanical knowledge


Experiences:


	2 years of experience in a technical support role.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Surfer Pilot (OOW DECK)

Job Location: Offshore, Nigeria

Roles


	Responsible and in charge of Navigation, Preparation, Maneuvering the vessel and managing emergency situations
	Supervise passengers and cargo transfer
	Ensures vessel tidiness and cleanliness, and routine maintenance
	In charge of compliance to Bourbon and Clients policies and procedures;
	Motivating personnel to apply policies and follow procedures, by providing information and familiarization and by carrying out emergency drills
	Conduct crew management and training
	In charge of reporting technical or operational incident to the
	Management necessary and practicable to do
	Responsible and in charge of Navigation, Preparation, Maneuvering the vessel and managing emergency situations
	Supervise passengers and cargo transfer
	Ensuring that the bridge is sufficiently manned at all times, taking into consideration the prevailing conditions and the principles of safe manning
	Reporting (Daily/Weekly/Monthly) as applicable and required


Qualifications, Skills and Experiences


	OOW DECK (NCV/UNLIMITED); STCW CERTIFICATIONS AS APPLICABLE
	2 years or more as a Deck Officer or Surfer Pilot


Click here to apply online

	We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Territory Development Executive from a FMCG to join our team.
	In this role, you will be responsible for expanding our market presence, developing new business opportunities, and nurturing relationships with clients and channel partners within your assigned territory.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and manage new business opportunities in the assigned territory.
	Establish and maintain strong relationships with clients, distributors, and other key stakeholders.
	Execute sales strategies to achieve growth targets and improve market share.
	Conduct market analysis to identify trends, competitor activities, and customer needs.
	Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations.
	Regularly visit customers and potential leads to promote products/services and close deals.
	Collaborate with the marketing and product teams to align strategies and campaigns.
	Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, sales activities, and territory performance.
	Provide feedback from the field to help improve products, services, and customer satisfaction.
	Participate in trade shows, promotional events, and networking opportunities.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field
	3 - 5 years of experience in sales, business development, or territory management (preferred FMCG).
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Proven ability to meet or exceed sales targets.


Salary
N164,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
